main event: A report describes the sighting of a shiny, round, flying object in Creston, Iowa in 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as having a silver glitter in the sun., It was observed directly over the station with very good visibility due to no cloud cover., The object was estimated to be about 8 feet in size., The report indicates the object was hovering and had a fast speed., The reliability of the witness is unknown.
